deck: A wealthy individual who donated to S.H.I.E.L.D., A.I.M., and Hydra.
description:
Elton Blake is a well connected man who was confronted by Nick Fury Jr. Nick Fury Jr. was disguising himself as Moon Knight while looking for Elton because he had recently faked his death and he believed Elton knew about a hidden threat within S.H.I.E.L.D. due to Mr. Blake donating to S.H.I.E.L.D. along with A.I.M., Hydra and other powerful groups.

Turns out Blake was paying the S.H.I.E.L.D. agents that attempted to kill Nick Fury Jr. in stocks and he felt he was justified in it to help S.H.I.E.L.D. an that Fury would be the organization's downfall. After feeling that the plans in motion couldn't be stopped Blake willingly told Fury where his leader resided and then proceeded to step off the roof of the building they were speaking on, killing himself.
name: Elton Blake

deck: African President/Dictator who frequently allies himself with Deathstroke. Deposed after his genocide of rebel tribes is halted by Deathstroke, he now does whatever he can to regain control of his country.
description:
Origin

A despot looking to control his country Buredunia with an iron fist but displaced by Deathstroke. He is currently looking for how to regain power.

Creation

He was created by Christopher Priest and Carlo Pagulayan. He is a pastiche of the Marvel superhero Black Panther on whom Priest had previously worked on and is closely attached.

Character Evolution

The character is in relative infantry and has not changed much outside of acquiring a costume that looks quite like the Black Panther's.

Major Story Arcs

The Professional

Matthew Bland is a despot committing ethnic genocide in his country. He hired Deathstroke to ensure that Congressman Hasgrove was re-elected, because Hasgrove was preventing U.S. intervention in his corner of Africa. in exchange, he would allow Slade to complete his contract on the Clock King, who was under his protection. Slade succeeded, and as a result, the country became a no-fly zone. However, Clock King captured Bland and revealed the whole truth; The contract to kill Clock King was secretly funded by him to lure Deathstroke to his country so he could kill Clock King and rig Hasgrove's election. Once he was dead, he would end Deathstroke, but Slade secretly goaded Hasgrove into committing suicide and kept the campaign funds for himself. Once Slade rescued him and ended Clock King, it is later revealed the truth behind everything that happened; it was all because he had been hired to get Deathstroke to change costumes, which he did successfully.

Later, the no-fly zone Matthew paid Slade to set up backfired when it emboldened the tribes he was trying to "cleanse" to stage a full-scale revolt. The rebellion escalated to the point where they managed to make it all the way to the presidential mansion. Ja Zaki managed to hole up inside as the rebels advanced, but before they could get inside, Deathstroke arrived to bail him out, feeling he owed him for the extra cash he managed to cheat him out of. When he managed to reach Bland, he not only shot at him, but sicced his pet lions on him as well. When he realized the mistake, he called them off and the two made their escape. Using rocket boots based on Steel's and a harness for Bland, Slade rocketed his boots into the air with plans to latch onto an overhead plane piloted by Wintergreen. However, Slade overshot and missed the plane. Before they could fall to the ground, Bland managed to grab onto the plane, sparing them both. They manage to get inside, but the plane, already in bad shape, gives out and crashes. Matthew is upset that the rebels have the upper hand, but Slade only cares about squaring things up between them.

The group then finds another plane and continues their flight. While Slade and Wintergreen fly the ship, Matthew takes a moment to talk to Slade's captive onboard; his daughter's boyfriend Richard. Matthew asked why he would try to kill Deathstroke's daughter, and Richard responds by asking if he fears Deathstroke. This strikes a nerve and earns him a punch. Matthew says that he isn't afraid and he and Slade aren't friends. Richard responds that he and Slade are both alike. Matthew responds that even though he and Slade are both killers, he kills in much greater numbers. However, they share one belief; mankind's flaws create perpetual war. He then goes on to say that being deposed will lead to more death than even he doles out, and that the wrong people will die. He also tells Richard that leadership is about knowing who the right people to kill are. Getting back on point, he asks again why Richard went after Rose. When he refuses to tell, Matthew's false Deathstroke guesses that he hates Deathstroke, but loves Rose.

Four Rooms

He and Slade part ways, but he briefly reappears at the end of the arc after Slade is captured and imprisoned at a government black site to break him out.

Twilight

Due to Slade rescuing him, he felt the need to make things even between them by breaking him out.

As he and Slade tear through the guards and cops, Matthew orders them to lay down their arms, but they refuse. They keep moving, and Slade is upset that he broke him out because of his misguided sense of "honor among villains." As Matthew steals a rifle and begin shooting, Slade asks if they are friends now, and Matthew replies that they are, temporarily. However, Slade knows he only freed him because he wants something, but Matthew actually believes Slade still owes him for causing him to lose his dictatorship. Slade thinks they are even, seeing as he tried to have him killed, but Matthew claims that was nothing but a simple business transaction. Slade responds he never needed a rescue, but Matthew then tell him about the false Deathstroke running around Chicago, and offer to fly Slade there. When he asks Matthew what he is up to, he replies that he only wants his country back. Slade thinks the breakout was some kind of revenge, and Matthew says it's partially true. Slade brings up the fact that he saved him from his rebel problem, but Matthew stills thinks his genocide was a better idea. Slade agrees to go to Chicago, but vows to return for answers.

Before returning for those answers, Slade decided to figure out why Ja Zaki freed him on his own. Eventually, he realizes that freeing Slade was only a distraction so he could free his real target; Raptor. Matthew enlisted Raptor to help him get his country back by stealing something to help him realize his goal. The object he wants is a aircraft carrier that belonged to a drug cartel boss Slade killed before he was locked up, now being converted into an oceanside casino. Once he and Raptor sneak on-board, they silently implement their plan to steal the ship.

When Slade arrives on the ship, he immediately tries to kill Raptor. As the two begin fighting, Red Lion shows up to witness the fighting and mocks Slade's old outfit, now in use because Raptor stole his new suit. As Slade and Raptor fight, they are thrown off balance and realize the carrier is moving. Red Lion ends the fight and explains the situation. Matthew has had several hundred sleeper agents enter the United States posing as refugees seeking asylum from his genocide. He instructed them to attach submersible jets to underside of the ship to tow it into international waters. He then asks the two to stop, but Slade only cares about getting his Ikon suit back. Slade explains that he knows what his plan in; He broke him out of prison to cover Raptor's escape, and had him steal the Ikon suit along the way to lure Slade to the carrier. Slade asks Matthew wants from all of this, and what he gets out if helping him. Impressed that Slade put all the pieces together, he says that all he wants is control of his country and people back, which he blames the US for losing.

Matthew explains that the previous owner of the carrier, was allowed to roam the seas freely thanks to the team Adeline runs protecting him in exchange for information. Because the carrier was bought and set to become a casino, it is an ideal target for Raptor, who likes to spite rich people. Most of the intelligence Adeline was getting was found, except for the intel capable of putting Adeline away for life, which is hidden in the ship's nuclear reactor chamber. Matthew then tells Slade his role; he needs the reactor turned back on to steal the carrier and use it to reclaim his country, but the chamber is still radioactive. Thanks to his healing factor, Slade is best equipped to put the fuel rods back into the reactor. In exchange for helping, he offers Slade gets the power to take down his ex, and Raptor gets to strike at the people who bought the ship. Deciding the risk is worth it, the two agree to the terms.

While Slade and Raptor reactivate the reactor, Matthew stays above deck to scout for opposition. That opposition eventually arrives in the form of Adeline and her team. They board the ship, and while he takes several of them down, he eventually defeated and restrained. However, he held them off long enough for the ship to reach international waters. Because the ship is flying his nation's flag, they have no authority to hold him. Deathstroke, having returned topside, he agrees with Ja Zaki. Though Adeline wants to take them down, the fear of losing men to Slade forces her to back off. Slade frees Matthew from his restrains and warns him that Raptor fled and may have sabotaged the ship. As the two prepare to part ways, Matthew asks Slade what he will do with the dirt on Adeline; save her or take her down.

deck: The grandfather of Connor Hawke
description:
A cattle rancher in Idaho, Nathan Hawke is the father of Sandra Hawke and grandfather of Connor Hawke. Nathan served in the Korean War. Sandra's mother is an unnamed Korean woman.

Connor stays with him for a time in Idaho after Ollie dies. Then, he and Master Jansen visit him again when Jansen loses the ashram.
name: Nathan Hawke

deck: A werewolf.
description:
She was found in Tibet by Gordon Sanders with gun shot wounds. Gordon aided Llhupa and the two eventually married and moved back to the United States. However unknown to Gordon at the time the reason she had a gun shot wound was because of him. Llhupa as it turns out is a werewolf and earlier she had attacked him as a wolf and had bitten him causing him to suffer the curse of lycanthropy.

It is unknown whether or not she was bitten herself or if she had always carried the affliction, but when Gordon put the pieces together and attempted to end her life she killed him instead. Not soon after she was killed by the Vision known as Aarkus.

Her appearance differs greatly from her husband who she inflicted with the curse. He appears to be a beastly half man half wolf but when Llhupa transforms she simply looks like a wolf.
name: Llhupa Sanders

deck: A man who struggled with the curse of lycanthropy.
description:
While traveling in the Tibetan desert Gordon was bitten by a wolf which cursed him into becoming a deadly uncontrollable wolf-man hybrid at midnight during a full moon. It was in Tibet where he met his wife who had been shot, he aided her and eventually they came back to the United States and were married.

It turns out the wolf that bit him was none other than his wife Llhupa in wolf form who ended up killing him when he put the pieces together. The injuries she received in Tibet were actually from Gordon's gun while she was in the form of the wolf.

Gordon Sanders is the first appearance of a wolf man in Marvel Comics (Timely at the time).
name: Gordon Sanders

deck: Leader of the Fire-Men.
description: He was the leader of a sect of people dubbed the Fire-Men who had the uncanny ability to resist the effects of fire enabling them to actually pick up and control flames. The group originated somewhere in Tibet and were fighting the forces of the Fire-Monsters.
name: Kalif

deck: Member of Promise.
description:
Origin

He was recruited by Tobias Messenger for his mutant team the Promise. Ernest seemed to act as Tobias' intelligence man when it comes to feeding information to Tobias when needed.

X-Men: The Hidden Years

When the X-Men were still fairly new in the world Tobias and the rest of the Promise decided to try and take the newest members of the X-Men, Lorna Dane and Alex Summers unwillingly into their group. Since Lorna and Alex had the least connection to Charles Xavier and his beliefs and perceptions of mutants Tobias felt they'd come around to their cause more easily. Lucy Robinson talked Tobias into also taking Warren Worthington III as well. Through the use of "teaching circuits" Tobias had hoped the new recruits would wake up with an understanding of his cause and join willingly after that.

However Lucy was able to rig her and Angel's suspended animation cylinder causing them to awaken in a much shorter time. She wanted out of the Promise because she believed Tobias has become obsessed with his dream and that he doesn't care who's lives he ruins in obtaining his goal. Lucy herself abandoned her family for Tobias's crusade to save the world.

Eventually Lucy was able to wake up Lorna along with the rest the Promise but suspiciously Tobias wasn't able to awaken even though his vitals were normal. It's suggested that Lucy had something to do with it. Ernest and the remaining members of Promise decided it best to remain awake and help mutants now before a war that may or may not even happen.
name: Ernest Scope

deck: Member of the Promise.
description:
Origin

He along with Gene Bitner, Simon Lestron, and a few others' mutant powers were used by the Yellow Claw to cause chaos. They were eventually freed from the Yellow Claw's hypnosis thanks to Suwan and Jimmy Woo of the F.B.I.

Soon later Craig, Gene, and Simon were recruited by Tobias Messenger for his team the Promise. Craig and Gracie seem to have some sort of romantic relationship with on another.

X-Men: The Hidden Years

When the X-Men were still fairly new in the world Tobias and the rest of the Promise decided to try and take the newest members of the X-Men, Lorna Dane and Alex Summers unwillingly into their group. Craig was able to use his power called dreamcasting to pit the X-Men against each other making them each appear as monstrous looking creatures to one another which caused them to take each other out. Havok was the only one remaining until Gracie kissed him and used some sort of energy drain mutant power to take him out as well. Since Lorna and Alex had the least connection to Charles Xavier and his beliefs and perceptions of mutants Tobias felt they'd come around to their cause more easily. Lucy Robinson talked Tobias into also taking Warren Worthington III as well. Through the use of "teaching circuits" Tobias had hoped the new recruits would wake up with an understanding of his cause and join willingly after that.

However Lucy was able to rig her and Angel's suspended animation cylinder causing them to awaken in a much shorter time. She wanted out of the Promise because she believed Tobias has become obsessed with his dream and that he doesn't care who's lives he ruins in obtaining his goal. Lucy herself abandoned her family for Tobias's crusade to save the world.

Eventually Lucy was able to wake up Lorna along with the rest the Promise but suspiciously Tobias wasn't able to awaken even though his vitals were normal. It's suggested that Lucy had something to do with it. Craig and the remaining members of Promise decided it best to remain awake and help mutants now before a war that may or may not even happen.

Craig and Gracie decided to adopt Simon in a way since he was still in the body of a kid they thought it better for him to stick with them.
name: Craig Farnsworth

deck: Member of Promise.
description:
Origin

He along with Gene Bitner, Simon Lestron, and a few others' mutant powers were used by the Yellow Clawto cause chaos. They were eventually freed from the Yellow Claw's hypnosis thanks to Suwan and Jimmy Woo of the F.B.I.

Soon later Craig, Gene, and Simon were recruited by Tobias Messenger for his team the Promise. The Promise would keep the team in suspended animation, only coming out every 10 years to search for new mutant recuits. During these intervals Gene watched his business be bought up and taken over by his competitors.

X-Men: The Hidden Years

When the X-Men were still fairly new in the world Tobias and the rest of the Promise decided to try and take the newest members of the X-Men, Lorna Dane and Alex Summers unwillingly into their group. It's suggested that Lucy had something to do with it. Gene and the remaining members of Promise decided it best to remain awake and help mutants now before a war that may or may not even happen.
name: Gene Bitner

deck: Member of Promise.
description:
Origin

He along with Gene Bitner, Simon Lestron, and a few others' mutant powers were used by the Yellow Clawto cause chaos. They were eventually freed from the Yellow Claw's hypnosis thanks to Suwan and Jimmy Woo of the F.B.I.

Soon later Craig, Gene, and Simon were recruited by Tobias Messenger for his team the Promise. The team would place themselves in suspended animation for ten years at a time and only come out for a week in search for new mutant recruits to join them. Unbeknownst to Tobias and Simon the teaching circuits in place allowed for Simon's mind to grow essentially giving him the mind of an adult while he was stuck in the body of a child.

X-Men: The Hidden Years

When the X-Men were still fairly new in the world Tobias and the rest of the Promise decided to try and take the newest members of the X-Men, Lorna Dane and Alex Summers unwillingly into their group. Craig was able to use his power called dreamcasting to pit the X-Men against each other making them each appear as monstrous looking creatures to one another which caused them to take each other out. Havok was the only one remaining until Gracie kissed him and used some sort of energy drain mutant power to take him out as well. Since Lorna and Alex had the least connection to Charles Xavier and his beliefs and perceptions of mutants Tobias felt they'd come around to their cause more easily. Lucy Robinson talked Tobias into also taking Warren Worthington III as well. Through the use of "teaching circuits" Tobias had hoped the new recruits would wake up with an understanding of his cause and join willingly after that.

However Lucy was able to rig her and Angel's suspended animation cylinder causing them to awaken in a much shorter time. She wanted out of the Promise because she believed Tobias has become obsessed with his dream and that he doesn't care who's lives he ruins in obtaining his goal. Lucy herself abandoned her family for Tobias's crusade to save the world.

Eventually Lucy was able to wake up Lorna along with the rest the Promise but suspiciously Tobias wasn't able to awaken even though his vitals were normal. It's suggested that Lucy had something to do with it. Simon and the remaining members of Promise decided it best to remain awake and help mutants now before a war that may or may not even happen.

Craig and Gracie decided to adopt Simon in a way since he was still in the body of a kid they thought it better for him to stick with them.
name: Simon Lestron

deck: Member of Promise.
description:
Origin

Lucy Robinson was just an average housewife with marital problems when Tobias Messenger approached her on account of her being a mutant. He offered he a place on his team called the Promise and said their goal was to save the world. Lucy got swept up in the team's crusade and ended up abandoning her family. Every 10 years the Promise would come out of suspended animation for a weeks time to search for new mutants to recruit and to see if the Tobias' vision of an inevitable human and mutant war has yet occurred. It was during these times of consciousness that Lucy would check in on her family which is when she learned that one of her children had died in Vietnam.

X-Men: The Hidden Years

When the Promise chose to take Alex Summers and Lorna Dane by force, Lucy talked Tobias into also taking Warren Worthington III as well. This however was a ruse so that she could rig the two of their sleeping pods to wake them up earlier from their suspended animation. Upon awakening from their much shorter sleep she asked the Angel to fly her to her son's home where she would confront him about what had happened. Michael the living son who was now older than his mother with a son of his own wanted nothing to do with mutants or the mother that abandoned him.

Soon after Angel learned that Lucy had the power of suggestion which is why he was so easily swayed to leave his friends behind and assist her to look for her son instead. The two then flew back to the Promise to aid the rest of the X-Men in their escape. After releasing Havok with the help of Professor X's astral form she helped Havok make up his mind to help stop Magneto with the use of her mutant ability. She also helped point Angel to the rest of the X-Men that were in a battle with the Mole Man while she stayed behind and tried to get Lorna out of her hibernation chamber.

Eventually Lucy was able to wake up Lorna and the rest of the Promise except for Tobias, who suspiciously couldn't wake up even though his vitals were normal moments prior. It's hinted at by Lucy herself that she had something to do with it and that Tobias is dead. Lucy and the remaining members of Promise decided it best to remain awake and help mutants now before a war that may or may not even happen.

issue_credits.name: Let Loose The Dogs of War

name: Lucy Robinson

deck: Member of Promise.
description:
Origin

At some point she was recruited by Tobias Messenger for his team the Promise. Gracie and another member of the Promise Craig seem to have some sort of romantic relationship with on another.

X-Men: The Hidden Years

When the X-Men were still fairly new in the world Tobias and the rest of the Promise decided to try and take the newest members of the X-Men, Lorna Dane and Alex Summers unwillingly into their group. Craig was able to use his power called dreamcasting to pit the X-Men against each other making them each appear as monstrous looking creatures to one another which caused them to take each other out. Havok was the only one remaining until Gracie kissed him and used some sort of energy drain mutant power to take him out as well. Since Lorna and Alex had the least connection to Charles Xavier and his beliefs and perceptions of mutants Tobias felt they'd come around to their cause more easily. Through the use of "teaching circuits" Tobias had hoped the new recruits would wake up with an understanding of his cause and join willingly after that.

However Lucy was able to rig her and Angel's suspended animation cylinder causing them to awaken in a much shorter time. She wanted out of the Promise because she believed Tobias has become obsessed with his dream and that he doesn't care who's lives he ruins in obtaining his goal. Lucy herself abandoned her family for Tobias's crusade to save the world.

Eventually Lucy was able to wake up Lorna along with the rest the Promise but suspiciously Tobias wasn't able to awaken even though his vitals were normal. It's suggested that Lucy had something to do with it. Gracie and the remaining members of Promise decided it best to remain awake and help mutants now before a war that may or may not even happen.

Gracie and Craig decided to adopt Simon in a way since he was still in the body of a kid they thought it better for him to stick with them.
name: Gracie Smith

deck: Leader and founder of Promise.
description:
Origin

Tobias was born in 1859 mute and deaf until his mutant powers activated at nineteen years old allowing him to communicate telepathically. Once he was thirty he started traveling around the world looking for other mutants such as himself. Around the age of 50 he had formed a group with mutants such as himself and together they were able to assist in ending the first World War. Within 10 years time Tobias was the only one left of the original group, the others succumbing to old age.

Once he was the sole survior of his group Tobias started to place himself in suspended animation emerging once every decade to record the progress of the world and to seek new mutants to join him in his cause. This new group became the Promise and Tobias was their leader. He knows a war between mutants and humans is inevitable and he wants himself and his group to be there during the aftermath to help lead and guide the mutants who he feels will inevitably win while also rebuilding for a better future.

X-Men: The Hidden Years

When the X-Men were still fairly new in the world Tobias and the rest of the Promise decided to try and take the newest members of the X-Men, Lorna Dane and Alex Summers unwillingly into their group. Since they had the least connection to Charles Xavier and his beliefs and perceptions of mutants they felt they'd come around to their cause more easily. Lucy Robinson talked Tobias into also taking Warren Worthington III as well. Through the use of "teaching circuits" Tobias had hoped the new recruits would wake up with an understanding of his cause and join willingly after that.

However Lucy was able to rig her and Angel's suspended animation cylinder causing them to awaken in a much shorter time. She wanted out of the Promise because she believed Tobias has become obsessed with his dream and that he doesn't care who's lives he ruins in obtaining his goal. Lucy herself abandoned her family for Tobias's crusade to save the world.

Eventually Lucy was able to wake up Lorna along with the rest the Promise but suspiciously Tobias wasn't able to awaken even though his vitals were normal. It's suggested that Lucy had something to do with it. The remaining members of Promise decided it best to remain awake and help mutants now before a war that may or may not even happen.
name: Tobias Messenger

deck: Teen hacker associate of Deathstroke and Red Lion

deck: Abandoned son of Lucy Robinson.
description: When Michael and his brother were children his mother, Lucy Robinson abandoned them to join Tobias Messenger's group of mutants called the Promise. Years later she returned to him with the X-Man known as Angel to try and explain to him what happened. She tells him that his father and her were fighting and that she was a simple housewife that was swept up in Tobias's crusade to save the world. Michael who was now older than his mother didn't want anything to do with mutants or the mother that abandoned him so he sent them both away.
name: Michael Robinson

deck: A S.H.I.E.L.D. Psych Expert.
description: Special Agent Carver is a Psych Expert for S.H.I.E.L.D. that was brought in to examine Vision's mental. During their interview Hank Pym entered Avengers Mansion demanding an audience with the Avengers acting like a completely new person and calling himself Yellow Jacket. Carver identified this as a mental health issue and told the Avengers to play along and that he may just snap out of it and that being aggressive or forcing the issue could send him into a complete mental breakdown.
name: Special Agent Carver

deck: Employee at Andrew Jackson High School.
description: Miss Parker along with some other members of the faculty of Andrew Jackson High School had a discussion about Delroy Watkins being bullied and that he was at a melting point. Miss Parker told Lucas Charles to keep whittling down his barriers and let him open up to him.
name: Miss Parker

deck: He is the Bureau Chief for the Justice League's Soviet Embassy.
description:
Origin

Boris Dmitravich Razumihin is the Bureau Chief for the Justice League's Soviet Embassy. This was during the Justice League International days. He would be the counterpart to Maxwell Lord of the American (New York) Bureau Chief, and Catherine Colbert of the French (Paris) Bureau Chief.

During his time as the Soviet Bureau Chief he was known as someone who was ruthless and could not be trusted. Always on time he at least on one occasion threatened to kill a taxi driver if he was late. He also at least knew about the bugging of the Justice Leagues Soviet Embassy and could have likely been behind it. These bugs were discovered by Batman and Guy Gardner who helped sweep the embassy with his power ring.

Creation

Boris Dmitravich Razumihin was created by Keith Giffen in Justice league International #8.
